We started off with Foie Gras, 3 ways. The terrine and the sandwich(?) preparation was delicous but the seared foie gras was a homerun. Succulent, juicy, and mouth-watering. After that we had a tiny peach-like sherbet to cleanse our palette. That 'tiny' sherbet is exlpoding with flavor. For the main course, I had a wagyu NY steak and my wife had Pan Seared Muscovy Duck Breast. Now I know how wonderful wagyu beef is. If I were to describe it ,it's like the full flavor of a rib-eye with the butter-iness of a filet mignon. With smoke bacon and a Pinot Noir sause, it is everthing I can imagine that perfectly compliments the steak. The chamonix potato though is somewhat lost with all the full flavors around it. My wife's Duck breast was excellent too. 

For our dessert, we shared a warm chocolate fondant. For me, thay have taken cocolate to a new level! the chocolate fondant was so delicious, it even topped itself when it was paired with the lime sherbet, a perfect combination.

The wait staff have a flawless attention to detail. We felt pampered. The sommelier even has an iPad for you to use to brose their selection of wines, cool! Lest I forget the absolutely stunning scenery of Las Vegas, the atmosphere in this resturant is romantic and scerene, especially during sunsets. Alize is 5 stars across the board.

10 out of 10 - Amazing! 
I took my girlfriend to Alize to celebrate her birthday, and we experienced absolute perfection. Everything from the service, the view, the first courses, and the entrées, we're utterly impeccable.
The view, and atmosphere are intimate, and beautiful. The wait staff are attentive, and really go the extra mile to ensure you feel like royalty. 
Their veal wellington was superb, as was their salmon trio, immaculate. 
Most memorable was their birthday surprise, which I won't reveal, as to not spoil it for anyone else, but it was definitely one of the most creative, and thoughtful birthday surprises we've ever experienced at a restaurant. 
All in all, Alize hits the mark on all levels, EXCELLENCE!

I had the honor of being able to order the 7 course tasting menu created by Chef Mark Purdy.  What an absolute impeccable experience I'm grateful Tysm to big boss for making this happen!  First dish per each course is Chef Purdy's modernized take on fine French cuisine.  The second course offerings pays tribute to Andre Rochat's renowned recipes.  Third course is an inspired vegetarian option.  I would highly recommend the Tradition Caviar, sautéed Foie Gras omg insanely TDF!  Tea smoke duck breast ... Never had duck delicately treated melt IYM!  The chocolate soufflé so decadent it really hit the spot :D.  These dishes are also offered a la carte.  The view is amazing on the 56th floor wow just gorgeous and there are 3 choices of bread the pretzel and rice flour is my fav!

Amazing dinner!!!!  We had the chief tasting menu.  Everything was delicious.  Service was stupendous.  Make sure you give yourself plenty of time to enjoy the experience.  We needed at least 2.5 hours to get through the 7 course menu.  Don't worry it looks like extremely small portions but by the time you get through them all you will be full.

We ate here last night and the food was superb. Unfortunately, they are too expensive for what you get. Two ounces of Seabass for $49 is ridiculous. The restaurant was half empty on a Saturday night and the hotel was packed. At the bottom of the menu it says minimum $49 entree per person. It's sad because Andre has always had some of the finest food in Vegas and so many people will miss out. I, for one, can not justify paying those prices for the serving sizes.

I absolutely love french food. Surprisingly, in a town like Las Vegas, good french food has been hard to find. It feels like each casino tries to do an "upscale European" restaurant and then most defaults to Italian. Other than Bardot at the Aria, Alize is our favorite french restaurant in the city.

Alize does have an amazing view. Unfortunately the Palms is a bit outdated, which is a shame -
 I would imagine Alize would feel more exciting and fancy if it was in a newer building. 

Alize has all the trappings of a great french restaurant. Rich flavors, decadent meat-centric dishes, foie gras, giant cheese cart, and moderate portions that leave you wanting more but leaves you room for rest of the meal. Pages of wine from bordeaux, burgundy, Loire valley, and champagne. And even more pages of wine from outside of those 4 regions.  Impeccable service with a slightly stuffy air - but in a good way. In the way that makes you feel like you should be dressing up to come here instead of wearing a muscle T and cutoff jeans like the rest of the restaurants in vegas.

We plan on returning to try the a lacarte menu. There is much lobster to be had.

This was one of my favorite restaurant experiences I can remember. I went to Las Vegas with my girlfriend over Thanksgiving Weekend 2011 to get away, and wanted to plan one nice dinner for her. We were staying at the Palms (where this restaurant is located on the top floor) and decided to try the hotel's French cuisine.

Boy were were impressed. They honored my requested for a window table and put us in the very corner by the windows with two sides of Las Vegas night view right next  to us. Gorgeous!

The service was impeccable. Aside from a little spillage blunder the food runner made on our tablecloth (it's okay, we didn't judge), the entire front of house staff that interacted with us was timely, friendly, efficient, and kept us eating and drinking at a perfect pace.

The food was outstanding. I can't remember the last time I've enjoyed food that much. Every bite was like a foodgasm!

While I can't remember the dessert we tried, here's what we had before that:

Pan Seared Foie Gras
Fuji Apples & Almond Crumble
Crème Anglaise, Port Reduction
**Wouldn't normally be a fan of Foie Gras, but this dish practically melted in our mouths...outstanding.

Honey Almond Crusted Rack of Colorado Lamb
Spicy Apricot Couscous, Curried Zucchini Fritter
Harissa Lamb Jus
**The honey almond taste was incredible, the port reduction was a great touch of flavor, and the fritter had great texture and was delicious!

Roasted Venison Loin
Venison Osso Buco & Bacon Croustillant, Chestnut Confit, Polenta Cake
Red Currant Purée & Poivrade Sauce
**The Red Currant Puree and Poivrade Sauce made an already savory venison loin that much better.

Possibly the most romantic and satisfying dinners out I've ever had. Thanks Alize, I'll recommend you to my Vegas-going friends!

After numerous websites telling me that Alize was the best restaurant in Las Vegas, I figured I had to give it a try.  After all, it received a Michelin star so my expectations were pretty high.  In fact, this was the first Michelin star restaurant I have ever been to.  

I'll say this up front- Alize is pretty damn good but fell slightly short of my high expectations of what Michelin star restaurants would be like.  I got the 7 course tasting menu for $135 to enjoy the real experience so I will go through each menu item in some detail.

First, the dissapoint- the bread.  For a fancy french restaurant the bread was pretty mediocre with a small variety of plain tasting bread and *HARD* butter which was preposterous.  Luckily, the rest of the meal didn't follow the same path.

Course 1- Rib Eye Carpaccio 

Pretty good but not great.  It didn't seem to distinguish itself from any carpaccio I have had at other lesser known restaurants.

Course 2- Sauteed Foie Gras

Fairly tasty but slightly underwhelming.  It didn't have all of those intricate and unique flavors that chef's usually add to a dish like this.  It had plenty of potentially flavorsome components but most were overpowered by the flavor of Foie Gras.  This certainly isn't a bad thing.

Course 3- Seared Scallop

Getting to the good stuff.  This was pretty delicious.  Perfectly made scallop and a lot of flavor.  I only wish there was more than one :(

Course 4- Pork Belly

I'll admit that I've had better pork belly before but this was pretty delicious and very flavorsome.  The vegetables in particular were nice accoutrements.

Course 5- Lamb Loin

Very flavorful and cooked perfectly. Delicious side of sausage too.

Course 6- BREBISROUSSE d'ARGENTAL aka fancy cheese

I'm not gonna lie, its just fancy cheese.  This one in particular was like a very salty brie cheese.  A bite with all of the components on the plate made it quite tasty.

Course 7- Chocolate Souffle

This dessert was about what I expected.  Very light and tons of chocolate but was clearly inferior to the peanut butter cheesecake my dining companion had.

At the end of the meal they serve little candy trinkets that were pretty good and were a nice light ending to the meal.

Obviously the view is great and you can see most of the strip.  So, if you are one of those people that really care about ambiance and all that, you will enjoy this restaurant.  In the end, I thought that the 7 course tasting menu was slightly below my expectations BUT I'd definitely return to the restaurant for a regular entree of the Lamb Loin or Seared Scallop.
Amazing food and the best most attentive service possible coupled with a fantastic view make for an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend.
Mediocre compared to other restaurants in hotel and pathetic compared to those in Vegas in general. Don't waste your time. So much more out there.

We looked over reviews for several restaurants before deciding upon Alize. 
All in all, a pretty decent meal was enjoyed, but for $400. without ordering a bottle of wine, decent shouldn't have been the opinion we were left with. I tried the filet with foie gras & shaved black truffles. This was exceptional. My girlfriend ordered the lobster thermadore; and while the presentation was impressive, the lobster was on the tough side. The main area of contention with us was the sommelier. we asked for him to make a choice by glass, as we we're going in such different directions with entrees. 
I briefly looked at price points for reds, and they topped out at just under $30.
I didn't  bother with the list for the white wine, and left that to him. 
The surprising reveal looking over the bill, was the white wine (Montrachet ) was 
$47. a glass. I payed the bill, decided against mentioning it at the moment, but ran into the sommelier in the hall on the way out. When I asked him why he didn't point out the quite high price point for the white, he replied " maybe you're not use to dining 
in restaurants of this caliber"  What an arrogant ass!. We dine in 
restaurants of this caliber, but no one wants to get blindsided with paying nearly fifty 
bucks for a glass of wine. The manage heard about our rant from the Ghost Bar 
bar keep, and contacted me to hear the story, and offer a credit on the bill. 
Well done by him. Hopefully the sommelier will have more consideration and tact
with his patrons in the future. This should on the main page review, but the stupid 
system fails again. I take the time to write this review only for it to be placed where few can see it.  A waste of time.

What a disappointment.
Took the chef menu which should have been stellar, and was far from it.
- the caviar was unremarkable and served surrounded by an awkwardly sweet jelly err "panacotta" and palate killing cinnamon blini
- the smoked salmon was delicious but served in pinky nail servings - so the little there was that was good was... very little
- the lobster thermidor was drowned in tarragon - it could've been $2 shrimp in there you could not have figured out the difference
- the short ribs were decent but nothing to write home about
- the grand marnier soufflé was great

So - save yourself $175 and skip this hot mess. I can't fathom how this restaurant will keep its Michelin star, it's giving the institution a bad name

Not only is there a fantasic veiw of the Las Vegas strip one floor above the infamous Ghost Bar, the food at Alize is some of the best tasting French food I have ever had.  The service is attentive and what you should expect at a fine dining restauratn.  I went there with three other friends on a Friday night.  Our reservations were at 8 but we were starving at 6:30 so we asked if we could be seated earlier.  The hostess was more than willing to get us seated early and with one of the best seats in the house, near the windows facing the strip.

Since my friends and I are foodies, we decided to each order an appetizer and an entree and sample each other's dishes.  The appetizers we ordered included: Andre's Foie Gras Terrine, Calamari Steak, Pan Seared Diver Scallops and Crispy Chorizo Ravioli, Angus Beef Carpaccio.  Each appetizer was very unique and got our palets stimulated and ready for our entrees.  We ordered Roquefort Cheese Crusted Chicken Breast, Roquefort Cheese Crusted Chicken Breast, Grilled New York Strip with Snow Crab Claws and Pan Seared Muscovy Duck Breast and Cherry Stuffed Duck Leg.  To top it off, we also ordered a bottle of merlot and a grand merier and a chocolate souffle for dessert.  

Total cost per person for dinner was around $100 which I felt was a bargin considering we each had an appetizer, entree, a dessert and ordered a bottle of wine.

We are heading to Vegas next week and already made reservations.  This is the ultimate fine dining experience in Vegas.

It was a dining experience.  Thats a rare thing to say about anywhere, and its getting harder and harder with the increase in fine dining. 
The place is on top of the Palms with a killer unobstructed view.  (the palms is a good ways off the strip)

The food is michellen star worth, your dishes are presented by staff.  Foe gras with Sautern is a newly learned pairing.   Try it.

Though, check the steak with melted cheese main course.  Seriously, is that really French?

Expect to drop $200/person for the full experience.  There's no other way to do it.

btw, after the tasting menu which we all left too stuffed to finish desert, I had Chicken McNuggets at 3 AM.  I remember being hungry, but maybe I'm a slob, or drinking and gambling works up an appetite, or maybe French food isn't fattening.

Next reviewer, please write if the same happened to you.

From the moment we stepped in this place was on it's A-game. The service was prompt & polite. The food was amazing. I ordered the filet and they cooked it perfect to my liking. Oh and the escargot is a must, the flavor is so powerful :).

Alize is top notch!  Our entire dining experience was exceptional.  It began with an amazing view, followed by delicious wine, wonderful ambience, impeccable service, the best Dover Sole I have ever eaten.  Our visit was to celebrate a birthday, and our restaurant choice truly made the trip to Vegas worthwhile.

Was invited to come here for dinner with suppliers and enjoyed our evening.
We had the best view of VEGAS.
I had the lamb and it was cooked perfectly.
The chef 4 different complimentary small dishes which was amazing.  The presentation of each dish was perfect. The only thing I would suggest for the restaurant is to provide three ipads for a group of 6 women instead of only one to get drink orders. Besides that everything was perfect . You absolutely get what you pay for. Will definitely come back here next year.

One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas.  French food at its best.  Stunning location on top The Palms.  Service was impeccable  .  Dover sole is to die for.  Appetizers are all delicious and creative   Souffles are divine.  Gr8 entrees and tasting menu.  Prices are fair for gourmet food and the amazing ambiance.

Food was amazing!!! I've never done extreme fine dining in my life, this place by far was extremely on point with service, food, drink pairings, etc. we went as a group of five people with a reservation. When you walk in, you can see all the bottles of wine, scotch, awards, etc. when you get past the see through wine cellar, you are hit with an amazing view of the Vegas strip. If you plan your reservation right and depending on sunset, you can see the sunset and the lights and the action come to life. The waiters were extremely nice, and attentive to details especially food allergies, and I have quite a few of them. It was a 4 course meal for us all. I felt bad for sending back the first round which was a watermelon with a balsamic vinaigrette, and cantaloupe something ( as soon as he said watermelon I tuned out and tried to figure out how to tell the waiter I can't have this dish) but he "didn't want me to feel left out" so he came back with tuna tar tar and a spring vegetable medley and I believe a vinaigrette dressing. Thank you to the chef for accommodating that first course! I ended up ordering the salmon plate. It was a delicious melt in your mouth plate, every single bite just brought a plethora of taste to my taste buds. Very romantic setting, great food and wine selection. Thank you to the waiters and the chef for a very amazing evening, you made this night memorable!

don't come here unless you plan to spend SERIOUS BUCKS. 
but the food was worth it. and romantic =)

FRENCH FOOD...very rich and creamy! 
the fish was the best ....basically tasted like butter. I think it was some sort of a filet. foie gras was soooo good. 
(personally, spago 's 12 course with wine is only $420 sounds better).  this is a 7 course. 

I suggest getting the chef's choice. 
WARNING: when you look at the menu it says chef's choice is $125 (I forgot the real amount) and then there is a separate WINE PAIRING. $175 for sommelier pairing. That DOES NOT MEAN you are getting wine pairing and chef choice together for $175. It means THE TWO CHARGES ARE SEPARATE. 

The food was yummy but I READ THE MENU PRICING WRONG.

Guess how much dinner was for 2? $680.00
it is by far the most expensive dinner I've ever had in my life.

I went to Alizé for a culinary field trip. My teacher wanted us to have an amazing dining experience and OMG we did. First off, the view is AMAZING! We were on the very top floor of the palms casino and it was gorgeous. I weaseled my way to the window seat. MUAHAHAHA!  There were about 18 of us. This place is very elegant. We started off with the tiny samples. We had, what I call, civeche. It was good. Next we had a trio which was, foie gras(duck liver), pork belly, and uhm.... I forgot the last one.  The foie gras melted in your mouth! It was good but very rich. After that I ordered the fillet mignon. It was alright. I wanted to ask for A1 so bad but I know they'd kill me. It was pretty cool because they covered each of our meals with a silver fancy cover. Each person had their own server next to them and all at once they took the lid of and said "wah Lah" It was cool! You only see that in the movies. The service was wonderful. They wanted everything to be neat. After that we ordered the chocolate soufflé. OMG that was heaven!! I was seriously in a food coma!! I had an amazing dining experience.  I don't think I would come back here if I was paying for it, but I am so happy I got the chance to come here.

To say that ALIZE is AMAZING, does not even begin to express what an AWESOME experience My husband and I had there for our 25th wedding anniversary.  We had the 7 course tasting menu and had the most amazing meal and service that in over 25 years of romantic special dinners and occasions all over the world, was hands down...the BEST we have ever had!  We were truly fortunate to have Luis as our server, and if you ever get the chance to go to Alize...ask for LUIS!  Luis made us feel as if we were in our own personal dining room and made sure that every single moment of our evening was just PERFECT.  Each course arrived, exceptionally presented and introduced by Luis....and then he would leave us for a moment so we could enjoy the experience....Im not ashamed to say that both my husband and I found ourselves moaning out loud at the exquisite flavors that we were enjoying...from the Russian Caviar...to the simply outstanding seared Foie Gras (to die for...really)...to the calamari (the best Ive ever had...honestly) to the lobster ragout...to the rack of lamb...to the rib eye....to the absolutely melt in your mouth Chocolate soufflé (I moaned...repeatedly...unashamed to admit it).  Alize was simply amazing, the food, the service, the amazing views off the 56th floor of the entire strip at sunset...I couldnt have scripted a more romantic and flavorful evening if I had tried.  To understand how amazing of a time we had...understand first that we flew to Las Vegas from Hawaii to celebrate our 25th anniversary...and that Alize was so amazing....that we flew back a week later....JUST to have dinner there again!!  My husband and I agreed that Alize is now our annual wedding anniversary celebration location....but we also agreed that any chance we get to head to Las Vegas...we are going to visit Alize and our favorite server, Luis!!

okay this place is very classy and romantic. the view is FABU!!!!! The food was really yummy! i didnt eat cause i was feeling kind of sick, but i got a salad and mushroom soup, which were both just ok. We got the calamari appetizer, i wouldnt really recommend it, cause it was very little. my cousin got the crispy duck, which was a special and it was DELICIOUS and very filling, my bro got the tune, which was just okay, and his gf got the chicken which was very DElish as well. we got the souffle desserts, which i would not  the prices were not outrageous. our server was kind of not friendly, which really pissed me off so i talked to the manager and he said thats weird cause hes normally the nicest one. but i think he was assuming we wouldn't tip well. so i took a star away because of him. I would recommend this place for the view (which u should request when u make reservations, but its still first come first serve for the window view).

We came here on a Sunday night with a $149 Travelzoo voucher for a 6-course dinner for two (no drinks).
Five stars for the view, the EXCELLENT cocktails, and because my date was absolutely wowed with their foie gras - it changed his life. 
I enjoyed the tartare and the seared scallop the most. To be honest, everything was tasty, the chef mixed so many interesting flavors together (that I would not expect) that I was surprised with every dish. 
It'a a bit out of the way but it's one of those must-have experiences - a fancy French restaurant at the top of the Palms overlooking the Las Vegas strip? Tell me that doesn't sound awesome to you.

I do not remember exactly what we had to eat, but I do remember loving the restaurant. Not only is the view spectacular, but the food is equally impressive. This is definitely a rarity for niche restaurants. In other words, good locations, views, celebrity chefs do not always equate to good food, this is not the case at Alize. The only reason it isn't a 5 star restaurant is because of the slower service. While it wasn't a problem, it was a bit slow. I will return here without question... maybe the best French in Vegas!
Super awesome fancy chef tasting menu. what a great experience.

Too many things to mention overall. 

But don't miss out on the Dover Sole. It is awesome.

What a view!!!  Real nice decor, professional service, and prices that I could tolerate (when in Vegas) make this place a winner.

I'll be back - thanks Andre!

I was not happy when the GM gave us an attitude about bringing my 3year old daughter the food was ok not the best ive ever had, the reason i went was only because i was looking for a place that offered gran Marnier souffle they offer it here but it was the worst. I make i better myself the good thing about the night was our servers amazing peolpe but not yhe general manager

This is probably the only restaurant that I can go to, where I'll eat anything that's put on my plate. I don't care if I don't know what it is, I know it's always going to be delicious. The food is absolutely mind blowing. The views overlooking Las Vegas are spectacular. Everything about this place is just amazing. One of the true five star restaurants, highly recommended!
great view, great service, food could of been way better and price was way to steep.. i felt like i was paying for the view

I' ve never dined alone...n at a very high restaurant...my sister was ill n couldnt make it...but she told me to go bcuz she didnt want me to miss out on an opportunity to eat delicious cuisine...n she was right! The people there made me feel very welcome there...friendly n excellent service...and the food! Delicious from apps to dessert! My favorite was the bone marrow topped with escargot, tiny heirloom tomatoes, garlic chips, some kind if wonderful green sauce n all on top of delicious mashed potatoes...all so very very delicious! The view at night was absolutey beautiful..the hotess said i could go ahead n go to windows n take pics but i was too shy lol..but overall a wonderful experience! I will b back and with my sister!

SAVE YOUR MONEY!

First of all, I told him it was my wedding night and wanted a good seat. They had us facing the suburbs of vegas instead of the strip. Then our food came. 
We did the 7 course tasting menu without wine,  $350 later we were hightly disappointed considering what we got. 

Maybe my expectations were too high but I honestly don't think this place is work the $$$$. Maybe you're paying for the view, just make sure you're facing the Strip. 

Service was great. I'll give them that.

We ate here for our birthdays (mine and a friend) not to long ago. Everything was delicious- from the Chef Tasting Menu to the wine, tea, and coffee. The staff was amazing as well - they were very attentive and knowledgable about their wines and food. At the beginning of our meal, we were given a key and a card saying that at the end of our dinner, we will be given a chest and inside is a birthday present. That birthday present was a cute little chocolate cake. It was super delicious. There are no other words to describe the food and our experience other than absolute amazingness!

About time I wrote a review for Alize, our third time. Each time was a great experience with over the top great service and delicious food. This time we got the best table in the house right in front facing the strip. We got the 7-course tasting menu again for our anniversary, and again it was a great experience.  These are smaller sized plates that allow you to try many special dishes. Felt like a judge on Iron Chef. 

The crab/octopus salad and seared foie gras were the highlights, just amazing. Foie just bursts in your mouth with savory flavor and paired well with the sweet gingerbread and marinated pears. The scallops and flat iron steak were delicious, but pretty standard for high end fare. The squab (like pigeon) was a little gamey, but interestingly hearty and surprisingly unlike poultry. Chocolate and sabayon soufflé ended the diverse meal along with bold rich coffee. The other dishes were good but somewhat forgettable. We also got a few freebees like amuse bouche, pre-dessert goody, and a "surprise" box of chocolate (in a small wooden chest with a golden key) as an anniversary gift. We got this last year so it wasn't a surprise, but very nice touch of service. 

2 years ago we got the amazing 14-course menu at Guy Savoy for our anniversary. It was 4x more expensive, and once in a lifetime remarkable experience (at least my lifetime). I have to say the view and food at Alize was more our style - things we enjoyed eating - so I would recommend Alize over Guy Savoy. This is something we can go at least annually for an upscale experience, delicious food and great view and not break the bank.

I signed up on yelp simply to review this restaurant! I have eaten at so many places in Vegas(Rosemary's,LeCirque, Picasso, SW), and this has to be my favorite. Their heirloom tomato salad was exquisite! I was thinking, "bring on the veal and duck", and was blown away by this small salad. If you're looking for a new spot, I promise you this will be it. Certainly on the pricey side, but well worth it.

With so many wonderful restaurants in town it was hard to chose a place for my birthday dinner. After much Yelp research I decided on Alize. We arrived at 5:30 and checked in with the hostess on the casino level. We were then whisked up to the 56th floor. It was a very cold and clear night so the views from the 56th floor were incredible. We were given a nice table for 2 along the windows. 

There was a nice thank you card from Alize waiting on the table with a key for a surprise later in the evening. Our waiter Marcos arrived to introduce himself and take our drink orders. After perusing the menu I decided on the french onion soup and veal wellington. My other half opted for the rack of lamb. After receiving our drinks the bread and two amuse bouche's arrived, both of which were excellent. 

With only a few other couples in the restaurant the service was impeccable, something you rarely see any more. The onion soup arrived and was delicious. I liked how they served it in an actual onion. The veal wellington was next up. Served with the classic silver domes being removed simultaneously. It was good, but not great. I didn't taste any of the described smoked prosciutto flavor, only the mushrooms. The veal was a little tough as well. It was also odd that it didn't come with any side dish, none were even offered. 

By this time it was getting much busier, with a large party arriving but still empty tables remained. We did not see Marcos after the entrees were delivered. We sat for quite a while until someone came and cleared the plates. We had to flag down Marcos to ask for the check. He brought over my "treasure chest" surprise which was just a very small piece of chocolate in a box. Still a nice gesture. 

Overall a very enjoyable meal with incredible views of the strip and city. Except for the end of the dinner the service was excellent. At this price point however it should be a 5 star experience from beginning to end.

Good food, not awesome. Service was slow. Our reservation was at 930. For thee people, drinks, appetizers and entrees, without desert... We didn't leave untill midnight. Then,the next day, I found out if you eat at Alize, you are entitled to free passes and entrance into the ghost bar...which out of the 7 staff members we encountered, all failed to mention that to us. 

Great view and food presentation.

I guess you can say I had high expectations for this place since it I read good reviews about it and the fact it was on the top floor of Palms and I was familiar with Chef Andre's work.  

We were sat right away after arriving in the middle of the restaurant which I was not a big fan due to the fact I wanted a seat by the window for the view.  Here's what we ordered: 

Pan Seared Scallops appetizer- 3 scallops?! for 29 bucks?! Hmmm..........no thank you 
12oz Australian Wagyu- Not what I had expected
and the girlfriend had the Duck which was cooked pretty good. 

Overall in a nutshell, probably my first and last time here.

This is my number 1 hot spot for a culinary experience with a view in sin city. 
The ambiance at this Place is just great with dark Wood furnitures, dimmed lights and classical Music playing soft in the background,  

We had our intmate wedding dinner here and couldnt be more happy with our pick. 
Our waiter and the sommelier where just the right kind of attentetive without hanging over your shoulder every 5 min as can be the case on some Michelin restaurants.  

We had a superb 7 meal course and every Little disg was just perfect in flavor as well as for the Eye. The staff also gave us a envelope with good luck wishes with all the stafffs signatures on as well as a promise of a surprise later on. The surprise was a golden key that opened a small wooden box with a miniature wedding cake. Such a nice treat! 

As described above Everything on this important day was Amazing. The pre-dinner drink, the wine, food , ambiance and of course view on +50th floor of The Palms.  

Our waiter also got us in at Ghost Bar the floor below wich was anice touch. 

Prices are not bad for the quality and we cant wait to go back!
Very expensive, but testy. Amazing lobster salat and soup of the day. Did like the service only.

Whenever I think of Alizé, I think of old school ghetto blue cognac being enjoyed by thugs and hustlas.  Well, with this Alizé, it's quite the contrary of that characterization.  Alizé is Palm's fancy schmancy 5 star, four dollar sign, restaurant, located on the 56th floor of the Palm's hotel and casino.  The view from up top is amazing, and the ambiance is very 5 star-ish, quiet with staff ready to serve you, place a napkin on your lap and scrape the bread off the table.

The restaurant has a extraordinary Zagat rating, won several awards, and even has a travelzoo available which makes it a must try restaurant in Las Vegas.  We dined here twice using a travelzoo which offered a 4 course meal and club tickets (which we never took advantage of).  With the meal comes a fancy drink as well.

The food was served in small portions, and was served with presentation, plate covers, garnishes and all.  I never did document what was served the two times I've dined here, but only remember that everything was really good.  I did take some pictures to give you an idea of what you are getting.
The service was good, but the food not.  You pay for the view.  Go to SF for a real restaurant
